sense.name: data
sense.examples: Statistical information indicates that Suzy is right. You can find all of the information you need on the internet.

sense.name: message
sense.commentary: a message received and understood; noun product of verb "to inform"
sense.examples: Information of his death was greatly exaggerated.

sense.name: entropy
sense.commentary: selective information - a numerical measure of the uncertainty of an outcome
sense.examples: The signal contained thousands of bits of information.

sense.name: accusation
sense.commentary: INFORMATION[+event] act of informing - formal accusation of a crime; the act of informing the police about a crime
sense.examples: Information would be greatly appreciated and informants will remain anonymous. The information was by the grandmother.
